```{r Inputting data & making sure everything is organized correctly}
rgb_all_ammonium.data <- read.csv("Master_RGB_Spreadsheet_AMMONIUM_Condensed_Red_1_12_23.csv", header=TRUE, sep=",",stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

str(rgb_all_ammonium.data)
rgb_all_ammonium.data <- na.omit(rgb_all_ammonium.data)


#Setting everything I need as factors for linear model and stats
rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_species<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_species)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_dose<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_dose)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_species_dose<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_species_dose)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$temp<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$temp)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$food<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$food)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$sym_state<-as.character(rgb_all_ammonium.data$sym_state)
rgb_all_ammonium.data$food_sym_state<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$food_sym_state)
#We want the math to treat colony number as a factor
rgb_all_ammonium.data$col_num<-as.factor(rgb_all_ammonium.data$col_num)

summary(rgb_all_ammonium.data$temp)

#lets check for normality in red_delta
hist(rgb_all_ammonium.data$red_delta)
qqnorm(rgb_all_ammonium.data$red_delta, main = NULL)
# it doesnt look normal, let's log it

#log transformed red delta
rgb_all_ammonium.data$log_red_delta<-log(abs(rgb_all_ammonium.data$red_delta))
hist(rgb_all_ammonium.data$log_red_delta)
#that looks good enough to do stats on

hist(rgb_all_ammonium.data$red_day11)

```


```{r Basic list of subsets}
# all aposymbiotic
all_apo<-subset(rgb_all_ammonium.data, rgb_all_ammonium.data$sym_state=="A")
# all symbiotic
all_sym<-subset(rgb_all_ammonium.data, rgb_all_ammonium.data$sym_state=="S")
# all fed
all_fed<-subset(rgb_all_ammonium.data, rgb_all_ammonium.data$food=="F")
# all starved
all_starved<-subset(rgb_all_ammonium.data, rgb_all_ammonium.data$food=="S")
# all 20C
all_20<-subset(rgb_all_ammonium.data, rgb_all_ammonium.data$temp=="20")
# all 30C
all_30<-subset(rgb_all_ammonium.data, rgb_all_ammonium.data$temp=="30")

#without controls
no_controls <- subset(rgb_all_ammonium.data, rgb_all_ammonium.data$N_dose!=0)
```


```{r rgb delta Model selection }
#were not going to look at genetic ID so let's do an lm

#stepAIC is from the MASS package
fullModel = lm(log_red_delta ~   N_species_dose + temp + sym_state  + N_species_dose*temp + N_species_dose*sym_state + temp*sym_state, data= rgb_all_ammonium.data) # model with all 9 variables and possible combinations

nullModel = lm(log_red_delta ~  1, data= rgb_all_ammonium.data) # model with the intercept only

summary(stepAIC(nullModel, # start with a model containing no variables
                direction = 'forward', # run forward selection
                scope = list(upper = fullModel, # the maximum to consider is a model with all variables
                             lower = nullModel), # the minimum to consider is a model with no variables
                trace = 1)) # do not show the step-by-step process of model selection

summary(fullModel)
#model it selected for:
lm_rgb_1 <- lm(formula = log_red_delta ~ N_species_dose + sym_state, data = rgb_all_ammonium.data)
summary(lm_rgb_1)

#lets check out some other models
lm_rgb_2 <- lm(formula = log_red_delta ~ sym_state + temp + N_species_dose, data = rgb_all_ammonium.data)
summary(lm_rgb_2)

AIC(lm_rgb_1, lm_rgb_2)

#linear model 1 is the winner here


plot_model(lm_rgb_1, type="diag") #data fitness looks decent
r2(lm_rgb_1)

```

```{r SYM linear model}
#stepAIC is from the MASS package
fullModel = lm(log_red_delta ~   N_species_dose + temp  + N_species_dose*temp, data= all_sym) # model with all 9 variables and possible combinations

nullModel = lm(log_red_delta ~  1, data= all_sym) # model with the intercept only

summary(stepAIC(nullModel, # start with a model containing no variables
                direction = 'forward', # run forward selection
                scope = list(upper = fullModel, # the maximum to consider is a model with all variables
                             lower = nullModel), # the minimum to consider is a model with no variables
                trace = 1)) # do not show the step-by-step process of model selection

summary(fullModel)
# it only selected for:
lm_sym_1 <- lm(log_red_delta ~  1, data= all_sym)

#lets see if we add the N_species_dose  what happens
lm_sym_2 <- lm(log_red_delta ~  N_species_dose + temp, data= all_sym)
summary(lm_sym_2)
#WINNER


AIC(lm_sym_1, lm_sym_2)

emm_sym_rgb_N_species_dose_temp=emmeans(lm_sym_2, specs=pairwise ~ N_species_dose)
summary(emm_sym_rgb_N_species_dose_temp)

#really no effect of dose

#graph sym only by N species dose and temperature

# Summarize by temp and N species dose so we can visualize
sum_N_species_dose_temp_ammonium <- summarySE(all_sym, measurevar = "log_red_delta", groupvars = c("temp","N_species_dose"))
sum_N_species_dose_temp_ammonium$N_species_dose <- factor(sum_N_species_dose_temp_ammonium$N_species_dose, levels=c("A_0", "A_5", "A_7.5","A_10"))
# Visualize
gg_N_species_dose_temp_ammonium<-ggplot(data = sum_N_species_dose_temp_ammonium,
       aes(x = N_species_dose,
           y = log_red_delta, col=temp)) +
    geom_point() +
    geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=log_red_delta-se, ymax=log_red_delta+se), width=0.1, size = 1) +
    #scale_color_manual(values = c("black", "darkgreen")) +
    ggtitle ("SYM CORALS ammonium rgb - Change in R channel value") +
    labs(x = "ammonium dose", 
         y = expression(paste("Change in R channel value")), 
         caption = "data represent mean +/- SEM" ) +
    scale_x_discrete("ammonium dose", labels=c(CNTRL_0="Control", N_1.5="1.5uM", N_5="5uM", N_18="18uM"))+
    scale_color_manual("Temperature",labels=c("20C","30C"), values=c("blue", "red"))
gg_N_species_dose_temp_ammonium


# generating ptemp and pdose:
summary(aov_temp<-aov(log_red_delta ~ temp, data=all_sym))
Anova(aov_temp, type="III")
summary(emmeans(aov_temp, specs=pairwise ~ temp))

#ptemp=0.9480

summary(aov_temp<-aov(log_red_delta ~ N_species_dose, data=all_sym))
Anova(aov_temp, type="III")
summary(emmeans(aov_temp, specs=pairwise ~ N_species_dose))

#pdose=0.1348  
  
#food for funsies
summary(aov_food<-aov(log_red_delta ~ food, data=all_sym))
Anova(aov_food, type="III")

#pfood=0.745

#food doesnt seem to matter at all
  
```

```{r Day 11 models}
#Day 11 is normally distributed so let's take a look at its model, since red delta wasnt as informative as we'd like
full.model_red_day11_ammonium <- lmer(red_day11~  N_species_dose + temp + food + sym_state + N_species_dose*temp + N_species_dose*food + N_species_dose*sym_state + temp*food + temp*sym_state + food*sym_state +  (1|col_num) + (1|exp_num) , data= rgb_all_ammonium.data)
summary(full.model_red_day11_ammonium )
print(step.model<- step(full.model_red_day11_ammonium ))


# DAY 11 IS NOT VERY INFORMATIVE
```


```{r Exploratory t tests}
t.test(all_20$log_red_delta, all_30$log_red_delta) #no difference

t.test(all_fed$log_red_delta, all_starved$log_red_delta) #no difference

t.test(all_sym$log_red_delta, all_apo$log_red_delta) #p=0.009
```

  theme_bw()+
  geom_point(size = 3, position = position_dodge(width=0.3))+
  geom_smooth(aes(group=sym_state), position = position_dodge(width=0.3), size = 0.5, method='lm', se = FALSE)+
 # geom_jitter(aes(), size=1.2, alpha=0.9)+
  geom_line(aes(group = sym_state), size = 0.5, linetype="dashed", position = position_dodge(width=0.3))+

gg_rgb_treatmeans_temp_sym<-ggplot(data = rgb_treatmeans_temp_sym,
       aes(x = sym_state,
           y = red_delta, col=temp)) +
    geom_point() +
    geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=red_delta-se, ymax=red_delta+se), width=0.1, size = 1) +
    #scale_color_manual(values = c("black", "darkgreen")) +
    ggtitle ("No controls ammonium rgb Delta sym state Temperature summary") +
  theme(legend.position="none")+
    labs(x = "Temperature", 
         y = expression(paste("Day 11  Red channel value")), 
         caption = "data represent mean +/- SEM" ) +
    scale_x_discrete("Sym State", labels=c("A"="Apo", "S"="Sym")) +
